pageContext.claim: “More than $600 million worth of surplus military equipment has been made available to law enforcement. This is equipment that was rotting. The best stuff, but rotting in warehouses that a past administration didn't want you to have.”
pageContext.analysis: This is mostly false. Obama scaled back the federal government's program of providing surplus military gear such as tanks and weapons to local police departments, a response to the images of militarized police during the unrest in Ferguson, Mo., in 2014. But Obama's restrictions clearly laid out a category of "controlled equipment" such as specialized firearms, manned and unmanned aircraft, explosives and riot gear that could still be provided upon demonstrated need. Trump says more than $600 million worth of equipment has been "made available," but that doesn't mean police departments are taking up these offers for surplus military gear. The New York Times reported in May 2018 that law enforcement agencies took in much more of this gear under the Obama administration than under Trump.
